title: 11 sentenced to life imprisonment in double murder case in Kurnool
content: They were convicted for the killing of YSRCP leader Kangati Lakshmi Narayana Reddy and his associate in 2017

title: BMRCL deploys AI-powered CCTV camera surveillance between Baiyappanahalli and M.G. Road
content: Commissioned on May 6, the system is designed to monitor not just the interiors of stations but also their peripheries, enabling real-time threat detection and anomaly tracking through AI-powered video analytics, according to BMRCL officials.

title: PIB cautions against ‘Pakistan-sponsored propaganda’, flags false claims
content: The unit, which functions under the Information & Broadcasting Ministry, said Pakistan-based handles were circulating an old image claiming that a Pakistani missile had hit an Indian S-400

title: Open drains turn death-traps in Vijayawada, five die in two years
content: The drowning of a seven-year-old boy on May 4, 2025 in Gunadala area triggers public outcry for safety measures by municipal authorities such as covering the drains to avert danger

title: Vizhinjam port’s Chinese link raises questions over next phase of procurement plans
content: A Union government order has placed restrictions on public procurement from countries sharing land borders with India, citing national security

title: Action plan helps takes Ariyalur to the top position in Class XII pass percentage
content: Daily coaching before and after school hours, regular tests, and conducting monthly reviews to analyse school’s performance helped us improve the pass percentage, says Chief Education Officer of Ariyalur district

title: Keltron, C-MET join hands to launch sensor-manufacturing hub in Thrissur
content: Facility is envisioned as a hub for sensor innovation, including an incubation centre for sensor technologies, development of sensor-integrated chips, and production of key electronic components

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu instructs officials to adhere to protocol
content: Pointing out the deviations at the pubic meeting organised for the restart of the Amaravati capital construction, he asks officials to focus on such issues next time

title: Circle Inspector of Police suspended for security lapse during CM’s event
content: Police Commissioner Iada Martin Marbianang has suspended Camp Police Station Inspector Altaf Hussain Mulla on the charge of security lapse

title: I’m a trained pilot ready to serve the country: Lalu’s elder son Tej Pratap Yadav
content: In a social media post, the elder son of Bihar Opposition party Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Prasad Yadav shares a picture of himself in uniform, along with four colleagues, and copies of his licence

title: Over 40 tmcft of water to be released for 3.64 lakh acres in Nellore district: Endowments Minister
content: Another 16 tmcft of water will be released from the Telugu Ganga project for 35,360 acres in Nellore district and 1,24 lakh acres in Tirupati district

title: It will be a new Vande Bharat Express from Belagavi not an extension, says Shettar
content: Contrary to the decision to extend the existing Dharwad-Bengaluru Vande Bharat Express, the Railway Board will run a new train

title: Basavanna represents all communities not just Lingayats, says Kore
content: He was inaugurating the Basaveshwara Jayanti programme organised by Sri Basaveshwara Study Chair of Karnatak University in Dharwad

title: Andhra Pradesh Cabinet lauds Operation Sindoor
content: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu discusses coastal security with the Ministers and advises them to remain vigilant on the issue

title: Pro-Synod group told not to defeat peace efforts
content: The One Qurbana, One Church movement, which came under official Church criticism, said it would not allow Mar Pamplany to carry out what the group claimed was “anti-Church consensus formula” in the Mass issue

title: TCS, JNTU Manthani collaborate for upskilling programme
content: Pilot phase will have 100 students, who will undergo a 20-week immersive training programme designed to bridge the gap between academia and industry

title: Smoke and scare: controversy over smoke at Kozhikode MCH building refuses to die down
content: The patients and caregivers of a recently built block of the Government Medical College Hospital, Kozhikode, had a providential escape last week as thick fumes engulfed the building after a suspected short-circuit. A.S. Jayanth meets some of the rescue workers and stakeholders to find out what went wrong in the public-sector hospital

title: Congress appoints Sunny Joseph as new Kerala unit chief
content: He replaces party veteran K. Sudhakaran, widely reckoned as the party’s strongman from Kannur and Communist Party of India (Marxist)‘s bugbear in volatile north Kerala politics

title: Cabinet passes resolution urging Centre to include ‘Amaravati’ as capital of Andhra Pradesh in Reorganisation Act
content: It also ratifies the decisions taken during the 47th CRDA meeting and approves the land allotments to various institutions in the capital region

title: Congress cancels rally against price rise
content: District in-charge Minister convenes emergency meeting to discuss heightened security concerns after the Pahalgam terrorist attack

title: Thalassemia burden in West Bengal higher than national average
content: Research says lack of awareness, intra-community marriages, and resistance to screening major causes for higher cases

title: Sarkeet movie review: A light-hearted drama on ADHD, with a lot of untapped potential
content: Thamar K.V.’s Sarkeet is a light-hearted drama tackling weighty issues with strong performances, but falls short of its potential

title: Vijayawada MP Kesineni Sivanath seeks CBI inquiry into Andhra Pradesh liquor scandal, denies involvement in it
content: Lashing out at his brother and former MP Srinivas and a vernacular daily for making false allegations, the TDP leader writes a letter to the CBI Director stating that people have a right to know the truth and see those responsible are held accountable

title: President grants prosecution sanction against Lalu Prasad in land-for-jobs ‘scam’
content: The ED chargesheeted former Bihar Chief Minister and his son, Tejashwi Yadav, and other family members in August last year in the money laundering case under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act

title: Security guard held for murder of eight-year-old boy in Bengaluru
content: The accused, identified as Chandeswar Matur, a native of Bihar, worked at an apartment complex in Rayasandra, Bengaluru. The victim, Ramananda, also from Bihar, lived in the same locality with his family

title: New method to transform coconut rachis into high-performance carbon material
content: A research team has engineered activated carbon from coconut rachis, an agricultural waste from coconut palms, one of Kerala’s most widely cultivated crops

title: Civil defence preparedness exercise within a week in Uttara Kannada
content: The district administration is making preparations for an exercise for effectively protecting citizens during times of crisis

title: Andhra Pradesh liquor scam: SIT searches houses of three accused, including that of YSRCP chief Jagan’s personal assistant Nageswar Reddy
content: The police recently arrested then IT Adviser Kessireddy Rajashekar Reddy, his personal assistant Dilip Kumar, and another accused Chanikya in the case

title: APSDMA forecasts sudden rains, possibility of lightning strikes in Anantapur district
content: People should take shelter under a building or a closed vehicle during lightning strikes and not stay in agriculture fields and open places, under trees or electric poles, says Collector

title: A.P. Governor presents Red Cross awards to eight Collectors for outstanding services
content: S. Abdul Nazeer virtually inaugurates Thalassemia Blood Transfusion Centre at Srikakulam and unveils plaque of Child Care and Skill Development Centre at Kakinada to mark World Red Cross Day and Thalassemia Day

title: Choice of de-escalation is with Pakistan: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri
content: Mr. Misri said escalation started from that side (Pakistan) with the April 22 Pahalgam attack in which 26 people were killed

title: Operation Sindoor: PM Modi chairs meeting with Ministries amid heightened security concerns
content: Prime Minister Modi chairs high-level meeting to review national security preparedness, emphasising alertness, synergy, and communication mechanisms for safety

title: Wall collapse: government suspends Executive Officer of Simhachalam temple in Visakhapatnam
content: Action follows inquiry commission’s preliminary report, holding the officer responsible for the incident during Chandanotsavam that claimed the lives of seven devotees

title: Tamil Nadu’s model schools have caught national attention with their results, says Stalin
content: Chief Minister inaugurates new buildings and hostels for boys and girls constructed at cost of ₹57.47 crore for the government model school at Thuvakudi in Tiruchi

title: Nobody wins in a war, says Kuvempu University V-C Sharath Ananthamurthy
content: Concerned over children talking about war with no idea of its impact, Mr. Ananthamurthy urged the need to make them read poetry on war and understand its impact.

title: I&B Ministry asks OTTs, media-streaming platforms, intermediaries to take down all Pakistan-origin content
content: Under IT Rules 2021, a publisher has to take into consideration whether their content affects the sovereignty and integrity of India, says the Ministry

title: Cash discovery row: CJI Khanna sends inquiry panel report on Justice Yashwant Varma to President, PM Modi
content: CJI encloses Justice Yashwant Varma’s response to the panel report; the development indicates that Justice Varma has refused to resign or retire voluntarily

title: Six, including four minors, killed in road accident in Haveri district
content: Six persons including three minor girls and a minor boy were killed on the spot and two seriously injured when an overspeeding SUV hit a truck from behind and overturned on the Pune-Bengaluru national highway near Motebennur in Byadgi taluk of Haveri district on Thursday.

title: Three Greyhounds personnel killed in IED blast in Telangana’s Mulugu
content: Eight Maoists including a top leader of the CPI (Maoist) were killed in an exchange of fire with the security forces in Karregutta hills

title: Given invigilator assignment in May without salary, say guest lecturers
content: Guest lecturers say they salary only for 11 months in a year and are asked to do invigilator’s duty in May when they do not get their regular salary and are paid a paltry daily allowance

title: Indian armed forces carried out Operation Sindoor with ‘unimaginable’ precision: Rajnath Singh
content: The Defence Minister congratulated the armed forces for displaying courage and valour displayed in carrying out the operation

title: United Kingdom discusses rising tensions between India, Pakistan in Parliament; appeals for de-escalation
content: The British Parliament debated rising India-Pakistan tensions after the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor, citing concerns for the U.K.’s large Indian and Pakistani communities

title: AERA revises tariffs, differential UDF for eco, biz passengers on intl flights from Mumbai airport
content: The landing and parking charges for the airlines have also been rationalised downwards and kept at reasonable levels, considering competitive airport charges at similar airports

title: National Herald case: Delhi court defers hearing against Sonia Gandhi, Rahul to May 21, 22
content: The court also decided to first hear the ED stand when case's complainant and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy sought a copy of the ED charge sheet

title: Sources: Quenneville to lead Ducks in NHL return
content: The Ducks are hiring Joel Quenneville as their new head coach, sources confirmed to ESPN, marking the former Blackhawks and Panthers coach's return to the NHL.

title: 'Desperate' Thunder get even, rout Nuggets by 43
content: Unwilling to fall into a 2-0 series hole, the Thunder put on a clinic in Game 2, scoring an NBA playoff record 87 points in the first half en route to beating the Nuggets 149-106.

title: Red-hot Rantanen sets records with G1 hat trick
content: The Stars' Mikko Rantanen stayed hot in Wednesday's Game 1, as his three-goal blitz in the second period made him the first player in Stanley Cup playoff history with multiple three-goal periods in the same postseason.

title: Bird gets newly made role on U.S. women's team
content: Sue Bird is giving another assist to USA Basketball, becoming the first managing director of the women's national team.

title: Knicks 'finding ways to win,' go up 2-0 on Celtics
content: Mikal Bridges scored all of his 14 points in the fourth quarter before making his second straight game-clinching steal, and the Knicks overcame a 20-point deficit again to beat the Celtics 91-90 on Wednesday for a 2-0 lead in the second-round series.

title: Cease loses no-hit bid, exits with forearm cramp
content: Moments after losing a no-hit bid in the seventh inning, San Diego Padres pitcher Dylan Cease left his start against the New York Yankees because of a cramp in his right forearm.

title: USWNT star Mallory Swanson expecting first child
content: United States forward Mallory Swanson is expecting her first child with husband Dansby Swanson, shortstop for the Chicago Cubs.

title: Stanton: Could rejoin Yankees when first eligible
content: Giancarlo Stanton (elbows) said he could return to the Yankees lineup by the end of the month, when he's first eligible.

title: 🎵 King of TikTok: 'LeBron James' song trend
content: Professional athletes have long been name-dropped in hip-hop songs, but R&B songs comprised solely of LeBron and Curry's names? That's a more recent phenomenon.

title: The biggest remaining roster hole for every NFL team: Where all 32 could still upgrade
content: Teams have added to their rosters through free agency, trades and the draft, but they all have at least one position that still needs a boost.

title: NFL experts debate the draft: Which midround picks could be fantasy sleepers?
content: A dozen experts weigh in on the draft with their top picks, Rookie of the Year predictions and fantasy sleepers.

title: Five surprising MLB performances -- and why they're happening
content: We break down a breakout bat, a prospect finally coming into his own, a power hitter who has stopped hitting home runs, and more.

title: Power Rankings: Tigers make top-5 debut as Mariners, Royals are on the rise
content: While NL powerhouses duke it out at the top, a new club is leading the way in the AL, with two others also on the up.

title: What should we expect from Shedeur Sanders in Cleveland?
content: Fifth-round draft picks don't typically carry the weight of expectations. Ahead of his first NFL practice, what's realistic for Sanders in a Browns uniform?

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Can the Capitals, Golden Knights get revenge in Game 2?
content: The Hurricanes and Oilers won the first game of their respective series. Here's what to watch on Thursday.

title: Ranking the Red Sox's options at first base: Devers back in the infield? A prospect moving positions?
content: Boston has plenty of in-house options to fill a sudden need. Here's what those in the game think is the best choice.

title: Top prospects for the 2025 NHL draft: Updated rankings after U18s, draft lottery
content: There's a consensus on the top four -- after that, all bets are off. Who will your team select in June?

title: Post-spring Way-Too-Early Top 25: Where do Texas and Notre Dame rank?
content: Where do the top teams stand after spring practice and roster movement from the transfer portal? Mark Schlabach updates the rankings.

title: GM is the new gold rush for college football
content: The general manager position is exploding in college football as more and more NFL personnel get involved.

title: We graded both sides of the George Pickens trade: How the Cowboys, Steelers fared in the WR move
content: Pickens is headed to Dallas for draft picks. Did the Cowboys solve their WR2 problem -- and did the Steelers create one? Let's size up the move.

title: Projecting how good the expansion Valkyries will be in their inaugural WNBA season
content: Historically, WNBA expansion teams have struggled in their first season. How many games might Golden State win in 2025?

title: Champions League final: Inter or PSG? Our experts make their picks
content: ESPN writers gaze into their crystal balls to predict who will be crowned European champions at Munich's Allianz Arena on May 31, Inter or PSG.

title: Beckham, Neville complete Salford City takeover
content: Salford City have been acquired by a new ownership group led by former England internationals David Beckham and Gary Neville, who were already investors in the club.

title: 3 hospitalized, 43 arrested as PSG reach UCL final
content: One person was in critical condition and two others also hospitalised after being hit by a car amid street partying by Paris Saint-Germain fans.

title: PSG boss relieved to avoid ex-club in UCL final
content: Paris Saint-Germain coach Luis Enrique is relieved to be facing Inter Milan and not former club Barcelona in the Champions League final on May 31.

title: PSG keeper credits Mother Nature for UCL heroics
content: Gianluigi Donnarumma's thanked Mother Nature for his heroics against Arsenal as Paris Saint-Germain booked their ticket for the UCL final in Munich

title: Police seize Maradona's medical records in raid
content: Police carried out an overnight raid at a Buenos Aires health clinic to seize Diego Maradona's complete medical records following a court order during the trial of seven health care professionals accused of negligence in the former soccer star's death.

title: Azteca to reopen in March for 2026 World Cup
content: Mexico City's Mayor Clara Brugada announced on Wednesday that the renowned Azteca Stadium will reopen in March 2026 after renovations to meet FIFA standards for hosting the 2026 World Cup.

title: Setting records and continuing a legacy: CJ Kirst is carrying on his family name
content: CJ Kirst is just the latest Kirst to make a name for himself and is leading Cornell into the NCAA tournament.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Inoue retains spot, Canelo falls after lackluster performance
content: Where do Naoya Inoue and Canelo Alvarez land after winning their fights this past weekend? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Raleigh in fantasy's top 25? Webb destined for Cy Young? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: The ultimate guide to your draft
content: André Snellings provides a blueprint to follow for fantasy women's basketball drafts including his ideal selections in each round.

title: Betting buzz: Curry injury shifts Warriors-Timberwolves Game 2 line five points
content: As oddsmakers continue to monitor Stephen Curry's hamstring strain, the Warriors' odds to win Game 2 against the Timberwolves have moved dramatically.

title: Clásico kits: Barcelona, Real Madrid's all-time best, worst jerseys
content: El Clásico is a clash of two of the world's most recognizable teams, Barcelona and Real Madrid. Both have iconic kits and shocking shirts in their closets.

title: Ancelotti's Real Madrid limbo explained: Why he could leave, and what comes next
content: As Carlo Ancelotti prepares for what appears to be his final Clásico, how could his last few weeks play out?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Napoli aim to beat Liverpool to De Bruyne
content: Napoli will make a concrete attempt to sign Kevin De Bruyne in the coming weeks. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: Sirens Sounded In Kupwara, Jammu Amid Rising India-Pak Tension
content: Operation Sindoor Live Updates: The Indian armed forces foiled attempts by the Pakistani military to engage a number of military targets across 15 cities in Northern and Western India using drones and missiles on Wednesday, the Centre said.

title: Paytm Owner, CEO, Brother Settle Stock Options Case, Pay Rs 2.8 Crore
content: One97 Communications Ltd, owner of the Paytm brand, its CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma and his brother Ajay Shekhar Sharma on Thursday settled with markets regulator SEBI a case pertaining to the company's Employee Stock Options by paying Rs 2.8 crore.

title: Video: Part Of Pak Missile Lands In Amritsar After India Intercepts Night Attack
content: India successfully intercepted and destroyed several missiles and drones launched by the Pakistani military at 15 cities in northern and western India in the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday, the government said today.

title: Nikki Haley Backs India's Right To Retaliate, Slams Pak On Terror
content: Indian-American Republican leader Nikki Haley on Thursday said that India had "every right" to retaliate and defend itself after the Pahalgam terror attack, asserting that Pakistan does not get to play the "victim".

title: Conclave  Movie Serves As Guidance For Cardinals Voting For Next Pope
content: Before entering the papal electionsto pick the next pope, several Catholic cardinals reportedly watched the film Conclave, starring Ralph Fiennes, to get a sense of the traditions and political undercurrents of the process.

title: After India's Strikes, 6 Applications Filed To Trademark 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Six trademark applications for 'Operation Sindoor' were filed on Thursday, a day after India unleashed a barrage of missiles on terror bases in Pakistan in a historic military operation, even as one of the petitions was withdrawn later.

title: Lahore Anti-Aircraft Site Hit: NDTV Explains India's SEAD Strike
content: A Pakistani air defence system installed in one of its major cities, Lahore, was destroyed in a counter-strike by India in the intervening night of Wednesday and Thursday, the Press Information Bureau said in a statement today.

title: "Pak Launched Targeted Attacks On Sikhs": Government Cites Poonch Gurdwara
content: Pakistan's claims that India had targetted its religious sites were shot down by the foreign ministry today, with a sharp reminder -- that it was Pakistani shelling that destroyed a Gurdwara in Poonch.

title: "A Pretext To Target?" India Rubbishes Pak Claim Of Hitting Dam In PoK
content: India has rubbished Pakistani claims that it has targeted a dam -- the Neelum Jhelum project -- during "Operation Sindoor", the retaliatory strikes against terror bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir.

title: PM Modi Meets Army Chief After Pakistan's Missile Attack, India's Response
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi amid heightened tensions between India and Pakistan.

title: Punjab Government Orders Complete Blackout In Gurdaspur From 9:00 PM To 5:00 AM
content: The Government of India and the Punjab Government have issued directives under the Civil Defence Act, 1968, to enforce a complete blackout in the Gurdaspur district from 9:00 PM to 5:00 AM, effective from May 8, 2025, until further orders.

title: Flying Of Drones Banned In Leh Amid India-Pak Tensions
content: Authorities in the Union Territory of Ladakh on Thursday prohibited flying of drones or Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) in Leh district, citing credible inputs and security concerns about their "potential misuse" by anti-national elements.

title: Nipah Virus Case Confirmed In Kerala's Malappuram District, Woman Infected
content: A case of Nipah virus has been confirmed in the Malappuram district of Kerala, health officials said on Wednesday.

title: Chief Justice Recommends Initiating Procedure To Remove Cash Row Judge: Sources
content: After receiving a report on the cash being allegedly found in a storeroom attached to the bungalow of Justice Yashwant Verma, the Chief Justice of India has written to the President and PM and recommended that proceedings be initiated to remove him.

title: All About The S-400 Defence System Used By India To Neutralise Pak Missiles
content: The Indian Air Force used the Russian-made S-400 missile defence system to negate Pakistan's escalation bid last night.

title: "When In Doubt, Go For India. This Should Be Our USP": Rajnath Singh On Defence Production
content: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh today pushed for domestic production of defence equipment, saying it is not a long-term solution.

title: Donald Trump Plans To Rename Persian Gulf, Iran Objects, Arabs Silent
content: Donald Trump is likely to ruffle a few feathers during his upcoming visit to the Middle East. The US President is likely to take a decision on whether to rename the Persian Gulf.

title: The Sharifs, 2 Generals, And Deja Vu For Pakistan
content: Pakistan remains a hybrid democracy at best. While civilian governments are elected in Islamabad, the locus of real power lies elsewhere in Rawalpindi, the headquarters of the Pakistan Army.

title: Singapore Issues Advisory Asking Nationals to Avoid Travel To J&K, Pakistan
content: Singapore has advised its citizens to defer all non-essential travel to Jammu and Kashmir in India, and to Pakistan, amid tensions between the two neighbours.

title: Did Pak shoot down Indian jets? What MEA said
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri has firmly refuted Pakistan's claims of downing Indian jets amidst heightened tensions following India's 'Operation Sindoor.' Misri highlighted Pakistan's history of falsehoods, citing instances dating back to 1947 and its alleged targeting of the Neelum-Jhelum dam.

title: Cash-at-home row: 'CJI recommends impeachment of Justice Varma'
content: Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna has recommended the impeachment of Justice Yashwant Varma following a Supreme Court panel's indictment in a cash recovery controversy. The CJI submitted the inquiry report and Justice Varma's response to the President and Prime Minister. Justice Varma has denied the allegations in his responses to both the Delhi high court Chief Justice and the Supreme Court-appointed committee.

title: Elon Musk warns 'All life on Earth will be destroyed by...'
content: Elon Musk, SpaceX founder, warns of the sun's eventual destruction of Earth, advocating for Mars colonization as humanity's long-term survival strategy. He emphasizes the urgency of establishing a self-sustaining civilization on Mars, viewing it as "life insurance" for humanity. SpaceX is actively developing plans for Martian habitats and addressing the challenges of establishing a permanent colony.

title: Pak exposed over Sajid Mir terror links, FATF grey list deception
content: Pakistan's shifting narrative on Sajid Mir, a key 26/11 plotter, has exposed its deception in combating terrorism, according to Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri. Initially declared a non-entity and then presumed dead, Mir's existence was later acknowledged amid pressure from the FATF.

title: On Pak's civilian killed claim, MEA replies with terrorist's funeral pic
content: India refuted Pakistan's allegations regarding civilian casualties in 'Operation Sindoor'. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri stated those eliminated were terrorists. He questioned Pakistan's state funerals for alleged civilians. Misri highlighted Pakistan's support for terrorism. He recalled Osama Bin Laden's presence in Pakistan. He mentioned the presence of UN-proscribed terrorists in Pakistan. The government previously described Operation Sindoor as focused and non-escalatory.

title: France President says US is committing error by withdrawing researchers’ visas
content: European leaders are actively courting American researchers with substantial financial incentives, viewing U.S. cuts to research funding as a critical mistake. France and the European Commission have pledged significant investments, totaling hundreds of millions of dollars, to attract talent and bolster their own research programs.

title: How India used 'Sudarshan Chakra' to take down Pak drones, missiles
content: In a swift response to Pakistan's aggression, India deployed its S-400 Sudarshan Chakra air defence system on May 7-8, successfully intercepting drones and missiles aimed at 15 Indian cities. The operation thwarted attempts to damage military installations, with debris recovered as evidence. India retaliated by neutralizing Pakistani air defence systems, including one in Lahore, after the attempted escalation.

title: Operation Sindoor: 'India is going to ...', says Donald Trump's close ally Laura Loomer in viral post on Twitter
content: Laura Loomer, a far-right activist, wished India good luck. This followed reports about India's Operation Sindoor. Loomer's tweet gained significant traction online. She is known for her controversial views and support for Donald Trump. Loomer has a history of making extreme statements. She has also unsuccessfully run for Congress. She remains a vocal figure in MAGA circles.

title: Operation Sindoor impacts PSL 2025: 2 matches cancelled, tournament in limbo
content: Amidst escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, the Pakistan Super League (PSL) faces uncertainty. A drone strike near the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium led to the cancellation of two matches, prompting discussions about relocating remaining fixtures to Karachi. Concerns among England cricketers and coaches have also risen following recent military actions, potentially leading to their early departure from the tournament.

title: Did Pakistan use Chinese jets against India? What Beijing said
content: Beijing responded to Pakistan's claim about using Chinese jets against India. China urged India and Pakistan to show restraint. They condemned terrorism. India rejected Pakistan's claim of shooting down Rafael jets. China supports Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack. Chinese officials met with Pakistani leaders amid rising tensions. Operation Sindoor retaliated against the Pahalgam attack.

title: Deepika Padukone on keeping Dua away from paparazzi: Top 5 news
content: Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh are keeping their daughter away from the paparazzi to protect her privacy. Sameera Reddy shared her weight loss journey focusing on balanced nutrition and exercise. Mandana Karimi faced backlash for her 'Operation Sindoor' post. Prateik Smita Patil recalled his intense first kiss with wife Priya Banerjee.

title: Op Sindoor: How India avenged beheaded US journalist Daniel Pearl
content: India's 'Operation Sindoor,' launched after the Pahalgam attack, has struck a JeM facility in Bahawalpur, potentially delivering justice in the 2002 Daniel Pearl murder case. The targeted facility was a known stronghold of Jaish-e-Mohammed, the terror group linked to Pearl's abduction and killing. This action brings a sense of closure to a long-standing tragedy.

title: 'Precision with which Op Sindoor was executed is unimaginable': Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh lauded the armed forces for 'Operation Sindoor,' which neutralized nine terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK with remarkable precision, eliminating numerous terrorists in response to the Pahalgam attack. Singh emphasized the operation's accuracy and restraint in avoiding civilian casualties. He warned adversaries against exploiting India's patience, promising a strong response to provocations.

title: 'Cardinals are rawdoggign it': CBS anchor faces Catholic fury
content: This digital blackout was the subject of discussion on CBS Mornings, with veteran Vatican correspondent John Allen explaining that the cardinals were entirely cut off from the outside world. Dokoupil chimed in, saying, “They’re raw-dogging the conclave—no phone, no text, no nothing.” Co-hosts Gayle King and Nate Burleson appeared momentarily stunned before continuing the segment with nervous laughter.

title: Operation Sindoor Day 2: How India is taking out Pak air defence systems
content: India retaliated against Pakistan's military and drone attacks by neutralizing their air defense system in Lahore. The response involved the Integrated Counter UAS Grid, Israeli Harpy drones, and reportedly, the S-400 Sudarshan Chakra. This action followed Pakistani attacks on multiple Indian locations and escalating border tensions, including civilian casualties.

title: How India foiled Pakistan’s plan to target 15 cities
content: India successfully thwarted Pakistan's drone and missile attacks targeting 15 cities, including Srinagar and Pathankot, on May 7-8. Indian air defense systems neutralized the threats, with debris recovered as evidence. Following this, India responded by striking Pakistani air defense systems, including one in Lahore. Ceasefire violations by Pakistan along the LoC resulted in 16 civilian deaths.

title: IWT: India opens gates of Baglihar, Salam Dams days after regulating Chenab flow
content: Amidst rising tensions with Pakistan and the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, India has opened two gates of the Baglihar Dam on the Chenab River. This action, following a prior restriction of the river's flow, aims to manage rising water levels due to heavy rainfall and maintain dam pressure in the region.

title: Glimpse into the future? Ayush Mhatre, Dewald Brevis and Urvil Patel offer potential look at CSK in IPL 2026
content: Chennai Super Kings, a dominant force in IPL history, are facing an unusual setback this season, languishing at the bottom. Their reliance on seasoned players like Rahul Tripathi and Ravichandran Ashwin hasn't paid off. However, youngsters Ayush Mhatre, Dewald Brevis, and Urvil Patel have shown promise, with Mhatre's impressive batting and Brevis's explosive half-century offering a glimpse of hope.

title: Pahalgam payback: Day 2 of Op Sindoor keeps Pakistan on edge
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh announced that Operation Sindoor is ongoing, vowing retaliation for any Pakistani aggression following India's strike on terror bases across the border. India continued Operation Sindoor, responding to Pakistan's ceasefire violations with proportionate force. India armed forces destroyed nine terror bases across Pakistan and Pakistan Occupied Kashmir (PoK) a day earlier in which "at least 100 terrorists were killed".

title: Operation Sindoor: India repels drone, missile attack across LoC
content: Pakistan initiated coordinated attacks on military targets in Northern and Western India. India's air defence systems successfully intercepted and neutralised all threats. India responded with targeted strikes on Pakistani air defence systems. This retaliation followed cross-border shelling by Pakistan in Jammu and Kashmir. Sixteen civilians were killed in the unprovoked shelling.

title: 16 killed in Pak shelling; Rajasthan, Punjab on high alert: Key points
content: Tensions escalate along the India-Pakistan border following "Operation Sindoor," a retaliatory strike against terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoJK. Indian armed forces targeted LeT and JeM bases with precision weaponry after the Pahagalam attack. In response, the government convened an all-party meeting, led by key ministers, to brief the opposition on the situation and diplomatic efforts.

title: Complete blackout in Gurdaspur from 9pm - 5am
content: Amid rising tensions with Pakistan, Gurdaspur in Punjab declared a complete blackout. This decision follows India's response to Pakistan's actions, including reported damage to Pakistani air defense units. Operation Sindoor, which targeted terror sites inside Pakistan, has further escalated the situation, leading to high alert status in Punjab, Rajasthan, and Gujarat with increased security measures.

title: Operation Sindoor: Several airports in India closed - check full list
content: Air travel faces disruption as several Indian airports halt commercial flights due to Operation Sindoor. The closure affects 27 airports across northern, western, and central India until May 10. Airlines like IndiGo and Air India cancel and reschedule hundreds of flights. Passengers are advised to check flight status. Affected airlines offer refunds and rescheduling options. Delhi airport also reports cancellations.

title: 'Operation Sindoor': PM Modi chairs high-level review meet on national security
content: Following 'Operation Sindoor,' Prime Minister Modi convened a high-level meeting to bolster national security. The operation was a response to the Pahalgam terror attack. PM Modi emphasised seamless coordination among ministries for operational continuity. He directed secretaries to review emergency response and communication protocols. Ministries are enhancing internal processes to address evolving threats and ensure readiness for any contingency.

title: Kenya: Thrown shoe a 'wake-up call' for President Ruto
content: During a public rally in Kenya, President William Ruto had a shoe thrown at him, highlighting growing discontent over the rising cost of living. The incident, which led to arrests, reflects public frustration with economic challenges and recent tax hikes. Citizens are urging the government to address their grievances and provide real solutions to ease the financial burden.

title: 'Operation Sindoor still ongoing': Rajnath Singh at all-party meet
content: In a recent all-party meeting, the government disclosed that 'Operation Sindoor' resulted in the elimination of over 100 terrorists across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, who chaired the meeting, emphasized the ongoing nature of the operation and India's readiness to retaliate against any Pakistani aggression.

title: 'Courts are not as fragile ... ': SC says Nishikant Dubey's remarks on judiciary
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded BJP MP Nishikant Dubey for his "highly irresponsible" remarks against the court's handling of the Waqf (Amendment) Act. Dubey's comments, including criticism of CJI DY Chandrachud and the court's rulings, were deemed as casting aspersions and reflecting ignorance. The BJP distanced itself from Dubey's statements, emphasizing respect for the judiciary.

title: Germany sees new debate over possible ban of the AfD
content: Germany's domestic intelligence agency has classified the Alternative for Germany (AfD) as a "confirmed right-wing extremist" movement, leading to immediate repercussions. Several federal states are now evaluating the compatibility of AfD membership with civil service roles. The AfD, which became the second-strongest political force in Germany in 2025, faces setbacks in its efforts to gain mainstream acceptance.

title: Fake news alert: Government fact checks 'Pak propaganda' on Operation Sindoor
content: The Indian government's Press Information Bureau (PIB) has debunked several Pakistani news reports regarding Operation Sindoor, launched by the Indian Armed Forces post the Pahalgam attack. PIB has flagged these reports as "Pakistan sponsored propaganda", including false claims of shooting down Indian Rafale jets and targeting the Srinagar airbase.

title: Military attack by Pakistan will be met with 'very firm response': S Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar asserted India's firm stance against any Pakistani retaliation following "Operation Sindoor," a targeted response to a barbaric attack in Jammu & Kashmir. During meetings with Iranian and Saudi counterparts, Jaishankar emphasized India's commitment to countering terrorism.

title: Op Sindoor Impact: IPL match to be shifted from Dharamsala
content: The IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Mumbai Indians has been relocated from Dharamsala to Ahmedabad due to the closure of Dharamsala's airport, confirmed by GCA secretary Anil Patel. This change has created logistical challenges for Delhi Capitals and Punjab Kings, who face a difficult journey from Dharamsala after their game.

title: Operation Sindoor Day 2: Nifty50 drops 150 points as tensions escalate
content: Operation Sindoor impact on stock market today: The NSE Nifty settled at 24,273.80, decreasing by 140.60 points or 0.58 per cent, with an intraday low of 24,150.20. The 30-share index Sensex closed at 80,334.81, down by 411.97 points or 0.51 per cent.

title: 'I remember ... ': Tendulkar's touching message for Rohit
content: Rohit Sharma has retired from Test cricket. He made the announcement before India's tour of England. Sachin Tendulkar shared an emotional message. Tendulkar gave Rohit his Test cap in 2013. Rohit played 67 Tests and scored 4,301 runs. He captained India in 24 Tests. His last Test was in Melbourne against Australia. He will continue to play ODI cricket.

title: From US to UK: How world leaders backed India's 'Operation Sindoor'
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam attack, India's 'Operation Sindoor' targeted terrorist camps in Pakistan and PoK, drawing strong international support. Western allies like the UK, France, and the US, along with Israel and Panama, backed India's right to self-defense against terrorism. Global leaders condemned the Pahalgam attack and urged Pakistan to address the terror threat within its borders.

title: Op Sindoor: 3 explosions rock Lahore, flight ops temporarily halted
content: Following Indian airstrikes on terror bases in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, a loud explosion was reported in Lahore, leading to temporary flight suspensions in Karachi, Lahore, and Sialkot. 'Operation Sindoor,' a tri-service mission, targeted Jaish-e-Mohammed, Lashkar-e-Taiba, and Hizbul Mujahideen infrastructure in response to the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, asserting India's right to act against cross-border terrorism.

title: 'Maine bhi pilot ki training le rakhi hai': Tej Pratap Yadav offers to serve nation
content: Amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan due to Operation Sindoor, RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav has offered his services to the nation, highlighting his pilot training. Yadav expressed his willingness to sacrifice his life for the country, stating that he would consider it an honor to serve, as conveyed in his post on X.

title: Operation Sindoor spooks Pak stock market! Trading halted with 6% crash
content: Following India's missile strikes on terrorist facilities, the Pakistan stock market, KSE 100, plummeted over 6%, halting trading. This crash, exacerbated by Operation Sindoor and previous economic measures by India, highlights Pakistan's economic fragility.

title: 'Wait! one player left': MS Dhoni's viral gesture melts the internet
content: Chennai Super Kings defeated Kolkata Knight Riders by two wickets, effectively ending the defending champions' playoff hopes. Dewald Brevis's explosive 52 and crucial contributions from Shivam Dube and MS Dhoni secured the victory. In a heartwarming moment, Dhoni's sportsmanship shone as he ensured KKR pacer Chetan Sakariya wasn't missed during the post-match handshakes.

title: 'He's our leader': Without Steph Curry, the Warriors look to Draymond Green
content: steph Curry's left hamstring injury gave the Golden State Warriors a 30-20 lead . he drilled another 3 from the top of the key, giving the Timberwolves a timeout . "i'll be back," Curry told Green as the point guard walked gingerly toward the tunnel .
